item.title: Intention in languages
item.description: Sometimes I think about what a bliss computers are. I don’t mean in a way of how they have improved our quality of life (which they did) and I’m not trying to disregard of the fact that they have had and will continue to have lots of implications on our social interactions and sociatal perception. What I mean is the fact that we now have these machines which obey exactly the way as we tell them to.

item.title: The Workhorse Group Story
item.description: The Workhorse Group Incorporated is a EV company which primarily produces delivery vans and got lately popular with a rising share price because it was viewed as one of the possible winners of an 8 billion USPS contract to replace old delivery vans. This contract busted, however I started writing this article before the deal busted - so don&rsquo;t be surprised by the high numbers. I owned this stock for several years and wanna display my view of the company in this blog post.

item.title: Modules, monoliths, and microservices
item.description:
What is a microservice? When are microservices a good idea? Lately, I get people asking me when microservices are a good idea. In systems design explains the world, I talked about big-picture issues like second system effect, innovator's dilemmas, and more. Can systems design answer the microservices question?
Yes, but you might not like the answers.
